Posts.Content: Jul 16, 2008 05:19AM - edited Jul 16, 2008 05:21AM by lilsunshine This is really confusing for you. I am so sorry you are going thru this, it must be so stressful, especially in light  of your sister's situatuion. I know with my bone tumor and now my new "lesion" in my other leg I see 2 drs, one in DC where I live and the other one in TX. I totally trust every word the dr in TX tells me. He has done all my surgeries and I know I am getting the best care from him. You need to find THAT dr that you can lay all your trust in. Hard to do when you are new to the game and everyone is telling you a different story. I myself am waiting for my 1st breast MRI{I have had countless Mri's and bone scans Pet scansEtc} and I wait to see what it will tell. The BCC dr told me that my inverted nipple could be a tumor behind it pulling it in. A lot to think about while you wait. I have a bone marrow problem that they can't decide whether it is a problem or not. Obviously it has been 2 yrs and I am still moving around , I have lost 25 lbs lately and run a low grade fever, and feel like crap all the time. THe area in my proximal femur hurts a lot now but I don't even say anything anymore. UNfortunately my favorite Othro ONc dr retired 2 yrs ago and the new one is OK , he too is a friend of my BIL , who is also an Ortho dr , but it's not the same thing. I guess until  I get a frank tumor like my last one a bone marrow thing is not exciting. I hope that you will get the right answers you need , and your sister will beat this. Monday will come for both of us and we will get good results. Bonnie
Posts.Title: Conflicting Test Results mommy2 leaf

She owns a nursery business and needs to be outdoors. So she stayed on it even though her younger sister had a double masectomy due to BC. She has breast calcifications .

Posts.Title: frustrated thebabylisa 2xigo

Posts.Content: Sep 26, 2008 12:04PM lilsunshine wrote: My daughter is 15, I rememnber well when she was 11 and they found an ovarian "mass" that was 6 cm. She had lost 20 lbs and was always so ill, everyone even her teachers was concerned.It took weeks frome the time they found the thing  til they Ct scanned her , bone scanned, US ed her to death and then she finally had the surgery. The Adult GYN onc dr was talking about a complete hysterrecomy  for my 11 yr old daughter! We were terrified but had not told her. They got in the surfical suite and found that it was just a series of complex cysts and were able to preserve all of her reproductive organs. She also had to have a kidney surgery 6 weeks later.  It is scary when our children are involved. We can sit back and think a litle more calmly when it is ourselves but our babies? No way!I hope that it is not BC, she is way too young to go thru something like this. She should be enjoying life and school and flirting with boys and getting A's in school. Not that I think she is too young to get BC, I know that this can strike any age,just like cervical cancer or ovarian cancer. I highly recomend the vaccine for HPV, Guardisil. We must protect our daughters now while they are still young enough. Bonnie
Posts.Title: 14 year old daughter,constant pain in left breast, lump detected ConcernedMom lilsunshine

Posts.Content: Aug 28, 2008 03:04PM - edited Aug 28, 2008 03:05PM by lilsunshine I have a question then? Tacking this along with hers as it pertain..... What about a person like myself who is 47, hasn't had a period in 3 yrs , all of a sudden gets this breast pain, nipple inversion and they find a fibroadenoma? {sorry about the spelling} Should I be worried about my biopsy results? My chest and back still hurt and so do my ribs on my left side. Now to top that off I went for my Pap today and I have to get an US because she said there is something a little "swollen" on my left ovary. HUH? I am falling apart. Probaly a fibroadenoma huh? HaHa Smokymama I found a great website that tells you everything you ever weanted to know about fibroadenomas , it is breastcancer.about.com/od/mammograms/p/fibroadenomas
Posts.Title: Are fibroadenomas painful? smokymama lilsunshine

Posts.Content: Sep 29, 2008 04:13AM lilsunshine wrote: Ann , Did you have inverted nipple and an aching dull pain in your nipple.? And all around your breast? Also my left underarm and down the left arm as well, it is hurting. I think this is lymph nodes.I also have what I think is a lymph node in my groin or down my thigh but the Gen Surgery drs dismissed me and said "Oh well it has been like this for over a year" ???? Can you believe this? I already have my 2nd opinion appt scheduled, as my core needle biopsy too was "inconclusive" and at 1st , they were like come back in 6 months , then the NP calls me and said the Rad Dr says they would feel better if I had another MRI in 3 months. I said I am not waiting 3 months! They had hinted they wanted to do an excisional biopsy, why didn't they? I think they didn't want to admit they were wrong? I don't know. The female Rad dr is the one I trust, I think she is the one pushing{pushed} for me to get what I did get. Good luck in your continued good health, Ekiz, I can't actually feel a "lump" but I have outward signs like 6 months ago , my left nipple all of a sudden  stated to invert. I had already noticed a slight size differenc. It didn't help that I had to go buy new bras as I had gone from a 38 c to a 36 b as I have lost 25 lbs since last Nov without trying! And I had noticed that while driving I had a spot on my "breastarea" that itched and I would scratch at it. Also wearing a seatbelt hurts  and puts pressure on my chest. I do have chest pain sometimes that will take my breath away, that is shooting from my breast! My nipples ache and almost feel as if I am nursing a baby but I am 47 and 3 yrs post-menopasual{sp}. The 1cm mass that was found on MRI was said to not be a fibroidenoma, now what it is , that is a mystery?THe biopsy  itself was really not that bad, although when the male Rad Dr said this, I wanted to smack him. He said it  like he was talking to a 5 yr old. I have had 7 major sirgeries and 2 Tyroid FNB and believe me those are actually much worse!HaHa Bonnie

Posts.Content: Jul 11, 2011 11:34AM lilsunshine wrote: I think the thing to look for is yellowing of the skin,eyes and if your stool "floats" due to lack of oil(?) in your stool. I know pain in the left quadrant is also a concern for pancreatitis(sp).I have liver mats as well and I know I am concerned about this but I was before I even knew about it because of Carcinoid symptoms I was having, carcinoid is an neuroendrrcrine tumor.Sorry about my spelling,morning is not a good time for me haha

Posts.Content: Oct 23, 2008 08:40AM lilsunshine wrote: Thanks Beesie, You know it is funny, I read your links and I have done all those things and more. I follow a good diet, I exercise 3 times a week{in the pool} and I take lots of Vits and Iron and Cal. I even went to my GI dr because I was having too many bowel movements a day{TMI I know} and had my 3rd colonoscopy in 8 yrs time. I got a clean bill of health this time, no more polyps. Anyway I am 47 and 3 yrs, almost 4 yrs{in Jan} postmenopausal. I too am not so sure if I want to put Estrogen in my system, of course I am not a dr but I have read up a little and it doesn't seem like it would be such a good thing given my family history,and now my symptoms. Oh well, I will wait to see what my MRI says. Bonnie
Posts.Title: Estrogen for breast pain? lilsunshine lilsunshine

Posts.Content: Aug 29, 2008 05:56AM - edited Aug 29, 2008 08:13AM by lilsunshine That's funny you should say a bump and not a lump as in a lymph node right? I have what I am sure is a lymph node in my left leg that has been swollen for over a year. My PCP {dr} told me it was an infected hair from shaving{I had to laugh at that one!} but I went back to her for my Pap smear a few weeks ago and said "Hello remember that infected hair? well it's still there} It's not that. Yesterday I had to go to the GYN dr for yet another Pap/ appt as she couldn't open my cervix. This dr said she didn't think it was a lymph node but it is definetely something. I have already had a tumor on my other leg so I am worried. Apparently there is something wrong with my bone marrow so I don't know. I have a "lesion" in my proximal femur close to this area so it could be associted to this, she is sending me to Gen Surgery, to find out what it is. If I had been to Mexico I would swear it was like on one of those TV shows and I had a big worm growing in my leg! OOH Yuck!  Suz Stay on top of your health and don't let anything slide by. I never let even the smallest thing, like my infected hair HaHa go past the drs as it could be the key to your life. Bonnie

I know nothing about this so I am curious about this. I am 3 yrs post Menopause so the only symptom I have is hot flashes but these are also a side effect of my anti-seizure meds so I never know what is making them occur.I am so upset about my symptoms and all this pain and the uncertainty of not knowing what is wrong with me. Will the Estrogen be of any benefit to me? I have to admit I am pretty ignorant about any of this. I guess it is the old head in the sand.I will try to research the internet but I am not good at the computer, I don't know how some of you find the links you do. Posts.Title: Estrogen for breast pain? lilsunshine lilsunshine

Posts.Content: Oct 22, 2008 04:35AM lilsunshine wrote: Are you also having anything else like inversion of your nipple? And pain in the rib? I am on my 2nd opinion and not sure where I am getting. I am going for my follow -up MRI after 3 months in a few weeks so I am anxious to see what it is showing. My biggest problem is that I am 47 and I do have hot flashes due to my AED{Epilepsy } and Menopause! Sucks big time as I am miserable, and I have lost 20 in the past year without trying which after 40 is really hard. I am tired all the time. I have even found myself wanting to fall asleep while driving so I stop at Starbucks to get a Latte. I am seizure free so it is not that, I am on 2 drugs for this so I am allowed to drive and haven't had a problem before. This is new. Kim at 39 you are right at the age where drs like to say you are too young or else they like to say you are getting older, haha. I love it, I tell them don't use the F word on me------------ Forty! Anyway I am glad that you are staying on top of this. You need to be diligent about your health, the tiredness could just be low iron BUT combined with your other symptoms the drs need to investigate your symptoms til you are satisfied. This is why I am going for a 2nd opinion. I had a bone tumor and basically diagnosed myself because the Dr at our clinic laughed when I went to see him and told him I needed to see an Ortho dr and that I thought I had a bone tumor. I did and I have an above the knee amputation and he was fired!!!! I wasn't the only one he screwd up with and our clinic got tired of his incompetence. Bonnie

Posts.Content: Nov 13, 2008 08:12AM lilsunshine wrote: Michelle, Try not to worry too much about the biopsies, I think you will do fine. They will be a little like going to the dentist, you know you get that shot for the filling then it is the pressure? Well it is a little more than that but we are brave! Make sure you take some Tylenol{ask 1st they told me to} and take your Mom or someone with you. I had mine and it was really not that bad, the rcuperation was a breeze. I have an above the knee amputation and have had 7 surgeries so I have had some serious recuperations for this. So I can tell you that I would {and probably will} do another breast biopsy anyday over leg surgery. Or a tyroid FNbiopsy. Ouch! Those are brutal. Please know that I will be thinking of you, Bonnie
